pages.text: The creation and management of spells is a complicated system to understand, and divided into multiple chapters.$(li)$(l:spells/introduction)The first introduction covers basic concepts, including imbuing.$()$(li)this chapter covers the mechanics of imposing modifiers$()$(li)$(l:spells/modifiers)The functional uses of modifiers and spells$()$(li)$(l:spells/library)The mechanics of the spell library and its uses$().

Spells each have a unique function. This function can be modified or augmented with modifiers. This section will discuss the process of applying modifiers using an imposer.$(br2)$(warning) For modifier costs and other functionality, see $(l:spells/modifiers)this entry$().$(br2)$(info) $(l:spells/introduction2#unlock)Unlocking$() modifiers is permanent for all your staffs.

pages.title: Imposers
pages.text: Inserting a staff into the imposer ($(l:spells/library)with spells selected$()) allows you to both insert modifiers globally and enable them for this staff.$(br2)$(info) Right-click an imposer with staff inside with a $(l:crafting/knives)knife$() to open the interface.

pages.title: Imposer: Spell Select
pages.text: The initial Imposer interface: click a spell to modify it.

pages.title: Imposer: Modifier Editing
pages.text: After clicking on a spell. [Player inventory present but not shown.]

pages.title: Modifier Editing
pages.text: As seen in the screenshots, you can click on a spell to open the modifier editing screen. The button labeled 'Back' will return you to the spell selection screen.$(br2)Colour of the border around the modifier, as well as the tooltip, $(l:spells/introduction2#colours)provide information.$()$(br2)$(info) A greyed-out square means that no modifier exists for this herb.

pages.title: Modifier Unlocking
pages.text: The process of unlocking a modifier is a simple one. It requires that you have the relevant herb in your inventory when you access the imposer.$(br2)$(info) Either shift-click the herb to automatically fill the slot, or click it into the slot.$(br2)$(info) Once unlocked, this modifier is permanently unlocked in your spell library and all staffs you open.

pages.title: Colour & Tooltip
pages.text: Yellow colouring and tooltip of 'Modifier not unlocked' mean the modifier is available.$(br2)$(info) Insert the relevant herb into the slot to unlock it.$(br2)Red colouring and tooltip of 'Modifier not enabled' means the modifier is unlocked but not enabled.$(br2)$(info) Simply click the slot to enable it.

pages.title: Colour & Tooltip
pages.text: Green colouring and no additional tooltip text mean the modifier is enabled.$(br2)$(info) Click the slot to disable it.$(br2)Purple colouring and 'Modifier conflicts' means this modifier conflicts with another modifier and cannot be enabled.$(br2)$(info) Disable the mentioned modifiers or hold Alt when clicking to disable them automatically.
